title: Spice & Herb Vocabulary
description: Season your vocabulary with knowledge about spices and herbs from cuisines around the globe

questions.question: What is the difference between a 'spice' and an 'herb' in culinary terms?
options: Herbs come from the leafy green parts of plants, while spices come from other parts like seeds, bark, or roots
Spices are mild, herbs are strong
Spices are fresh, herbs are dried

questions.question: What is 'saffron' and why is it so expensive?
options: The dried stigmas of the crocus flower, hand-harvested from each bloom, making it the world's most expensive spice by weight

questions.question: In spice terminology, what is 'turmeric'?
options: A bright yellow-orange spice from a root related to ginger, used widely in Indian and Asian cuisine

questions.question: What does 'coriander' refer to in culinary vocabulary?
options: Only the leaves of the plant
Both the seeds and leaves of the same plant â€” seeds are called coriander, leaves are often called cilantro

questions.question: What is 'cardamom' in the spice world?
options: An aromatic seed pod from a plant in the ginger family, used in both sweet and savory dishes

questions.question: In herb vocabulary, what is 'basil' primarily associated with?
options: Italian and Southeast Asian cuisines, where it is used fresh in dishes like pesto and Thai curries

questions.question: What is 'cumin' in the spice world?
options: A warm, earthy spice from dried seeds, essential in Mexican, Indian, and Middle Eastern cuisines

questions.question: What does 'star anise' look like and taste like?
options: A round seed with a citrus flavor
A star-shaped seed pod with a distinct licorice-like flavor, used in Chinese and Vietnamese cooking
A brown bark with a cinnamon flavor
A green leaf with a minty taste

questions.question: In spice terminology, what is 'garam masala'?
options: A warming blend of ground spices common in Indian cooking, typically including cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and more

questions.question: What is 'oregano' best known for in cooking?
options: Mediterranean and Mexican cooking, especially in pizza, pasta sauces, and chili

questions.question: In spice vocabulary, what is 'paprika' made from?
options: Dried and ground peppers, ranging from sweet and mild to hot and smoky depending on the variety

questions.question: What is 'vanilla' derived from?
options: The cured seed pods of a tropical orchid, one of the most popular flavors worldwide

questions.question: In herb terminology, what is 'rosemary'?
options: A type of flower used in bouquets
A fragrant, needle-like Mediterranean herb used with roasted meats, potatoes, and breads

questions.question: What is 'nutmeg' and where does it come from?
options: The nut of a hazelnut tree
The seed of a tropical evergreen tree, used ground in baking, sauces, and beverages like eggnog

questions.question: In spice vocabulary, what is 'clove'?
options: A dried, aromatic flower bud from a tropical tree, used whole or ground in both sweet and savory dishes
